entry.title: Halifax joins rivals in cutting mortgage rates
entry.summary: The UK's biggest mortgage lender will sharply reduce rates as the market shows signs of slowing.

entry.title: Wilko to stay open for now in race to save jobs
entry.summary: The homeware retailer will continue to pay its 12,500 staff after falling into administration.

entry.title: NI police chief says officers 'anxious and angry' at data breach
entry.summary: The chief constable apologises after the identities of thousands of officers are mistakenly revealed.

entry.title: Lauren James: England forward given two-game Women's World Cup ban after red card
entry.summary: England forward Lauren James is given a two-match ban by Fifa for her red card in the Women's World Cup game with Nigeria.

entry.title: Tottenham and Bayern agree deal in principle for Kane
entry.summary: Bayern Munich and Tottenham agree a deal in principle for England captain Harry Kane worth more than 100m euros (£86.4m).

entry.title: Ecuador politician murder: Prison gangs in terror reign
entry.summary: A presidential candidate has been killed in the latest assassination in Ecuador as gang crime soars.

entry.title: Prosecutors want man who killed wife in Cyprus to face new charges
entry.summary: He was convicted of the manslaughter of his ill wife in Cyprus but could be tried again for murder.

entry.title: Oxford Street disorder: Suella Braverman wants culprits to be hunted down
entry.summary: The kind of lawlessness seen in some US cities must not be allowed here, the home secretary says.

entry.title: Hospital waiting list tops 7.5 million in England
entry.summary: Nearly one in seven of the population is waiting as NHS bosses cite impact of strikes by doctors.

entry.title: No 10 suggests UK still EU member in tweet gaffe
entry.summary: A now-deleted post said the UK "is home to twice as many AI companies as any other EU country".

entry.title: Disney to launch cheaper ad-supported service in UK
entry.summary: It comes as the streaming giant tries to boost subscribers amid a sharp drop in advertising sales.

entry.title: Russian convicts released to fight with Wagner accused of new crimes
entry.summary: Victims' families are distraught that Russian prisoners released to fight in Ukraine are reoffending.

entry.title: Sunscreen: Tackling myths around darker skin and SPF
entry.summary: Global studies show some minority communities are less likely to use sun protection - but why?

entry.title: Fact-checking claims about asylum seekers
entry.summary: The Conservatives and Labour have made claims about asylum seekers - are they true?

entry.title: Football referees: Why should I be abused for 90 minutes?
entry.summary: Referees Maria Creaney, 37, and Halle O'Brien, 16, speak out against threatening behaviour and sexism.

entry.title: Edinburgh Fringe digs cost us more than our £10,000 prize
entry.summary: Performers face sky-rocketing accommodation costs and many have little chance of breaking even.

entry.title: Sir Anthony Hopkins to play man who saved 669 children
entry.summary: The two-time Oscar winner will star as the man dubbed the British Oskar Schindler.

entry.title: Why are tensions mounting on the Belarus-Poland border?
entry.summary: Poland is sending extra troops to its border with Belarus after an alleged military incursion.

entry.title: Niger's coup leader General Tchiani: The ex-UN peacekeeper who seized power
entry.summary: Gen Tchiani has triggered a major crisis by overthrowing the president he was meant to guard.

entry.title: Is AI a threat to the world of fabric design?
entry.summary: You can now ask an artificial intelligence system to design you a fabric pattern and get it printed.

entry.title: US families face desperate choice: Food or insurance
entry.summary: Extreme weather and climate change are driving up home insurance costs, forcing some into desperation.

entry.title: Ukraine war: Russia still gets key war kit despite sanctions
entry.summary: An elaborate network of intermediaries means Russia can lay its hands on vital bits of Western technology.

entry.title: Strictly contestants 2023: Annabel Croft and Nigel Harman join line-up
entry.summary: The broadcaster joins celebrities including Bobby Brazier, Jody Cundy and Ellie Leach on the show.

entry.title: Luton Town: Airport backs Hatters with flight path message
entry.summary: London Luton Airport creates a huge grass painting ahead of Luton Town's first Premier League match.

entry.title: Two Doors Down creator Simon Carlyle dies aged 48
entry.summary: BBC bosses pay tribute to the comedy writer who helped create the popular BBC One series.

entry.title: Tributes to British surgeon Kar Hao Teoh killed in South Africa
entry.summary: Surgeon Kar Hao Teoh, who worked at a hospital in Essex, is described as "a friend to many".

entry.title: Be quick off the mark for top uni clearing spots, students told
entry.summary: Highly selective courses at elite universities will "go quite quickly", says the head of Ucas.

entry.title: Telescope records stunning footage of Milky Way
entry.summary: Located on a dormant volcano in Hawaii, the telescope takes pictures of deep space.

entry.title: UK spent £13m on private schooling for diplomats’ children
entry.summary: The amount the Foreign Office spends on sending children of diplomats to top private schools has increased.

entry.title: Period pants should not be subject to 20% VAT, say firms
entry.summary: Marks & Spencer and the brand Wuka are asking the government to remove a 20% tax on period pants.

entry.title: Surrey shop accused of racism removes image of tobacco plantation
entry.summary: The image appears to show black people working on a tobacco plantation overseen by white men.

entry.title: Last-minute summer holiday bookings rise as Brits flee rain
entry.summary: Travel agents are reporting a rise in people booking overseas trips due to the drizzly UK weather.

entry.title: Special King Charles Coronation 50p coins issued
entry.summary: Five million new 50 pence pieces bearing the King's head are going into circulation.

entry.title: Premier League predictions 2023-24: BBC Sport pundits pick their top four
entry.summary: We ask 27 BBC pundits to predict who will win the Premier League title, who will finish in the top four and who might break into the top six.

entry.title: Erling Haaland: Watch Manchester City striker's best Premier League goals of 2022-23
entry.summary: BBC Sport looks back at some of Erling Haaland's best goals from his record-breaking first Premier League season as the champions prepare to launch their 2023-24 campaign at Burnley.

entry.title: England recall Owen Farrell and Billy Vunipola for Wales World Cup warm-up at Twickenham
entry.summary: England head coach Steve Borthwick names an experienced team for the World Cup warm-up match against Wales at Twickenham.
